p: Disruption of immunization services around the world puts children at risk of diseases like diphtheria, measles and polio. Efforts have to be deployed to help maintain immunization programs and mitigate the impact of the pandemic, especially in lower-income countries. The Covid-19 pandemic has turned on an alert on how much collective health depends on the responsibility of each individual and also on how important the role of vaccines is to keep global population safe and healthy.
